channel.title: My Project - RSCBase
channel.description:
I'm making a new base from scratch (I don't care if you think it's stupid, it's none of your buisiness)... I'm tired of rscd/demonik, and I just don't like it (not debating about this, or elaborating)...
[b]Key features:[/b] Regions - Players in regions will update together, and only loop through them, instead of everyone in the world
Caching - Going to be storing more data in ram, for things like bans, jails, mutes, ect
Quest System - Self explanatory...
Multiple Worlds - I know it's already in rscd, but I'm adding it and having it so it shows friends online in diff worlds, ect
"Script" sysem - For things like additional features, like npcs, object, ect able to update without server restart
Auto Updating - Going to be using checksums to check files (should also help fight bots)
[b]Comments:[/b] Going to make it so you can easily customize it... Also, removing xml files. Putting settings into ini files. Npcs, items, ect into MySQL.
Going to make it bug free the first time around (hopefully)
Using Netty for the networking bit.
ATM I'm calling it RSCBase, might change later.
I am releasing this once I feel it's ready.
[b]Progress:[/b] [b]World Management[/b] - Done. You can add handlers by simply putting the files in the packethandler folder. [b]Server - Everything done but content[/b] Engine - Done Connections - Done Tasks - Done World - Done Regions - Done Basic Content - Foundation Laid Quest System - Pretty much done, still need to add sine things AutoUpdating - Done [b]Database Management[/b] - Done [b]Database Connector[/b] - Done
Will add more to the above once I get the base of both done.
Total time spent: Over 5 hour 38 minutes Note that includes planning, and any time on it, even if it doesn't has my undivided attention (aka me talking to ppl on vent/msn/irc)
[b]Question:[/b] Should I create a completely new client, or just modify the RSCD client?
[b]Note to readers[/b] I don't care if you don't like what I am doing, or if you agree with me on starting from scratch. I don't want to hear it. Although, I would like/welcome constructive criticism/advice (I.E. You can add this feature, or do this to make it faster/better). Mods, if you see spam/flame in this topic, please remove it without hesitation.
[b]Wiki[/b] http://rscbase.wikispaces.com (completely outdated)
I will be posting some of the files on there, and updating that along with this post.

item.title: My Project - RSCBase
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

freaky5000:

I’m quite impressed, i’ve been looking over your wikis space. The structure in which you have decided to use is very smart in it’s simplicity, as for the putting the objects into the MySQL it’s a good idea but it’s just creating more work for yourself isn’t it? Also, any specific reasion for using MINA 2.0.0-RC1 for your communication?

The xml can be ported to MySQL rather easily…

I’m using MINA 2.0.0-RC1 because I’m familiar with it’s earlier versions, and use it quiet a bit, so I’m just keeping up to date with it…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 14, 2009, 11:27:53 am[/size][hr]I’m pausing this project to see what the next move with RSC is…

Read full topic

item.title: My Project - RSCBase
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

darscape:

Sounds like hes given up. Nothing posted.

No, I’ve been really busy the last couple days, I’m going to start working on it again Monday.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 08:06:43 pm[/size][hr][quote=“object, post:42, topic:311614”]It doesn’t matter how much you store in the memory of your server, as long as it doesn’t run out. In fact, it could even be better to store it there, because to read/write from/to the memory of your server is much faster than to read/write from/to any other storage medium.

Also, good luck with your server! Fun to see someone try from scratch again…

Edit: Haha, how stupid am I? The server already stores it all in the memory (even if just temporary when it is running). So yeah, like Peeter asked, why store more in the memory? More as in if there are more features is valid, but other than that I cannot see any point of validity…[/quote]
Bans, jails, mutes, ect the way I have seen them implemented are queried from the database every time it needs to be checked, so I’m going to have it load all of them at start up, and when one is added or removed, it will be changed accordingly…

Read full topic
